intro: Hypolytrum hoppioides, commonly known as the hoppy buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. It produces small, oblong fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Hypolytrum hoppioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
